meanings.def: kept at a very low temperature in order to preserve it
examples: a major producer of canned and frozen foods
He fumbled in his pocket with frozen fingers.

meanings.def: with a layer of ice on the surface
examples: There were skaters on the frozen river.
The surface of the lake is permanently frozen.

meanings.def: covered with ice; so cold that it has become very hard
examples: They adapted to the harsh conditions of the frozen north.

meanings.def: unable to move because of a strong emotion such as fear or horror
examples: frozen with something She stared at him, frozen with shock.
frozen in something His white face was frozen in fear.
I stood frozen to the spot, unable to speak.
